newsitem.title: TURKEY: Iraqi Kurd leader in talks with Turkey's Ciller.
newsitem.headline: Iraqi Kurd leader in talks with Turkey's Ciller.

text.p: Baghdad-backed Iraqi Kurdish leader Massoud Barzani met Turkish Prime Minister Tansu Ciller on Wednesday ahead of his first talks with U.S. officials since seizing control of northern Iraq.
Witnesses said Barzani arrived at Ciller's residence wearing a dark suit instead of his usual Kurdish traditional costume for talks on security on the Turkish-Iraqi border.
Barzani, head of the Kurdistan Democratic Party (KDP), was to hold talks later in Ankara with Robert Pelletreau, the U.S. assistant secretary of state for near eastern affairs.
Washington was expected to press Barzani to end further cooperation with Iraqi President Saddam Hussein in a bid to pick up the pieces of its shattered policy on north Iraq.
Barzani's forces, backed by Iraqi troops and tanks, captured the Kurdish city of Arbil from a rival militia last month, prompting U.S. missile strikes on southern Iraq.
Washington pulled back its military, aid and intelligence operations from Iraq, fearing that Barzani's new ties to Baghdad would endanger U.S. personnel and their local staffs.
The evacuation of hundreds of Kurdish families linked to U.S. efforts in the predominantly Kurdish north undercut Washington's ability to influence events in the remote region.
